title: Genetics & Heredity Assessment Exam
description: Comprehensive assessment of genetics and inheritance principles

questions.question: What is the genotypic ratio of offspring from a cross between two heterozygous individuals (Aa × Aa)?
questions.explanation: The cross Aa × Aa produces AA, Aa, Aa, aa, giving a genotypic ratio of 1 AA : 2 Aa : 1 aa.

questions.question: According to Mendel's Law of Segregation, each parent contributes one allele for each trait to their offspring.
questions.explanation: The Law of Segregation states that allele pairs separate during gamete formation, so each gamete carries only one allele for each gene.

questions.question: In a dihybrid cross between two heterozygous individuals (AaBb × AaBb), what fraction of offspring will be homozygous dominant for both traits (AABB)?
questions.explanation: Probability of AA = 1/4, probability of BB = 1/4. For both: (1/4) × (1/4) = 1/16.

questions.question: The observable characteristics or traits of an organism are called its _______.
questions.explanation: Phenotype refers to the physical expression of genes, while genotype refers to the genetic composition.

questions.question: A homozygous dominant individual (AA) is crossed with a homozygous recessive individual (aa). What percentage of the F₁ generation will show the dominant phenotype?
questions.explanation: All offspring will be Aa (heterozygous), and since A is dominant, 100% will show the dominant phenotype.

questions.question: DNA is composed of two complementary strands forming a double helix structure.
questions.explanation: DNA has a double helix structure with two antiparallel, complementary strands held together by base pairing.

questions.question: If a DNA strand has 30% Adenine, what percentage of the strand is Guanine?
questions.explanation: If A = 30%, then T = 30% (A pairs with T). That leaves 40% for G and C combined. Since G = C, then G = 20%.

questions.question: Two plants heterozygous for height (Tt) are crossed. What is the probability that out of three offspring, all three will be tall?
questions.explanation: Probability of one tall plant = 3/4. For three independent events: (3/4)³ = 27/64 ≈ 42.19%.
